intro: Didymocarpus albinus, commonly known as the white-flowered sandarac tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
